result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Morgan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Anthony Morgan in court.  
Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Michael Anthony Morgan.  
Attorney Edward OBrien in court for State of Wisconsin. 


Case in court for a  Preliminary Hearing. 
Defense counsel advises the court the defendant is seeking private counsel and request an adjournment. 
Defendant confirms. Defendant waives time limits. Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08-31-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
Court orders the Defendant to continue making timely child support payments.

Defendant Michael Anthony Morgan in court.  Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court for Michael Anthony Morgan.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/29/22 @ 2p
